description: The Senate voted to confirm Jay Bhattacharya, a Stanford University health economist and physician, to lead the National Institutes of Health.
title: Senate Confirms Jay Bhattacharya to Lead NIH

description: The head of the US Federal Housing Finance Agency ordered to end Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac programs intended to support first-time homebuyers by providing down payments and closing cost assistance.
title: FHFA Chief Ends Program Designed to Help First-Time Homebuyers

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will blame global economic headwinds as she slashes UK government spending by billions of pounds, in the face of growing criticism from within her own Labour Party that she risks alienating voters.
title: Reeves to Cut UK Spending by Billions of Pounds: What to Watch

description: Republican leaders say they are getting close to agreeing on a plan to pass an extension of President Donald Trump’s 2017 tax cuts and an increase to the debt ceiling, as Congress looks to approve an economic package by the end of May.
title: GOP Moves Closer to Tax Cut Plan, Eyes Debt Ceiling Deal

description: New York officials are calling on the federal government to deliver more aid to New York City’s public transit system, even as the Trump administration ramps up its threats to roll back funding.
title: NY Asks Trump for More MTA Aid Despite Threat to Pull Transit Funds

description: China’s ambassador warned the Canadian government against using it as a “bargaining chip” in trade negotiations with the US, but said it’s ready to pursue a bilateral free trade agreement if Canada removes barriers to Chinese investment.
title: Envoy Warns Canada Against Using China as ‘Bargaining Chip’ With US

description: Los Angeles is looking to California for financial help as the city faces a nearly $1 billion budget deficit projected for the next fiscal year.
title: Los Angeles Presses State for Help With $1 Billion Deficit

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the controversy over an administration group text that included a reporter. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Team Tunes Out Chatter About Signal Blunder

description: The US Treasury is planning to lay off a “substantial number” of employees through an effort to reduce the size of the US government led by Elon Musk, according to language submitted in a court case by an official at the department.
title: Treasury Plans ‘Substantial’ Layoffs as Part of Musk’s DOGE Push

description: Vice President JD Vance said he would join a delegation visiting Greenland this week, even as the trip has sparked criticism from local leaders in the Danish territory that US President Donald Trump has suggested should come under American control.
title: Vance to Visit Greenland on Trip That’s Inflamed Local Leaders

description: The crisis in Colombia’s health system has reached “critical” levels as it fails to provide patients with access to medical services and medication, the government’s independent human-rights watchdog agency warned.
title: Colombia’s Health System Teeters With Medication in Short Supply

description: The Trump administration has paused some green card applications as it seeks to beef up scrutiny of potential permanent residents, the latest step in a far-reaching overhaul of the US immigration system.
title: Trump Halts Some Green Card Applications in Bid to Boost Vetting

description: President Donald Trump said he is in favor of defunding National Public Radio and the Public Broadcasting Service, casting the outlets as unfavorable to him and a drain on taxpayer money.
title: Trump Says He Would ‘Love’ to Defund Broadcasters NPR, PBS

description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order Tuesday that would seek to cut federal grants to states who don’t adopt tougher standards for voter registration, the latest Republican step in the political fight over access to the voter rolls.
title: Trump Signs Executive Order to Toughen Voter Registration Standards

description: President Donald Trump directed the Treasury Department to modernize and centralize its payment system in an effort to root out fraud as money is transferred throughout the federal government.
title: Trump Directs Treasury Department to Modernize Payment Systems

description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order targeting the law firm of Jenner and Block over the role of a former partner at the firm who aided onetime special counsel Robert Mueller’s investigations.
title: Trump Signs Executive Order Targeting Law Firm Jenner and Block

description: The EU and Japan both fret about a world without the US security umbrella. They could ease their fears by moving closer together.
title: The Security Alliance the World Needs Now

description: Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa retired the commander of the army, appointing him as the new sports minister.
title: Zimbabwe Names New Sports Minister to Replace Kirsty Coventry

description: The messaging app Signal that Trump administration officials used to discuss an attack on Yemen’s Houthi rebels was created by a one-time anarchist to help activists, journalists and others communicate beyond the prying eyes of government intelligence agencies.
title: Signal App Favored by Activists at Center of Houthi Strike Chat

description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is taking steps to ensure protests across the country don’t worsen and to contain a rout in financial markets, even as he turns the screws on opponents.
title: Erdogan Treads Carefully to Quell Protests and Calm Markets

description: Denmark will start drafting women into its military from next year, accelerating planned reforms to boost the size of its armed forces and help counter increased threats from Russia.
title: Denmark Speeds Up Plans for Mandatory Military Service for Women

description: Bridgewater Associates founder Ray Dalio warned House Republicans of the dangers of rising US deficits and urged them to get spending under control, lawmakers attending the meeting said.
title: Dalio Warns House GOP of Debt Peril as Lawmakers Weigh Tax Cuts

description: Elon Musk’s demand for federal workers to submit five bullet points detailing their week’s work has hit a new snag: the inbox is full.
title: Elon Musk’s ‘What Did You Do Last Week?’ Email Clogs Government Inbox

description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy sees partial ceasefire taking effect after the US published statements from talks in Saudi Arabia and Ukraine will implement it, he told reporters in Kyiv on Tuesday.
title: Zelenskiy Says Ukraine to Implement Partial Ceasefire Now

description: Two educational unions sued the Trump administration over its withholding of $400 million in federal funding from Columbia University, calling the move an illegal attempt to limit academic independence and free speech on campus.
title: Trump’s Columbia Funding Halt Draws Academic Union Lawsuit

description: The US’s top two intelligence officials defended their participation in a Signal messaging chat in which attack plans for strikes against Houthi rebels were shared, and denied that the information they discussed was classified.
title: Top US Intel Officials Defend Signal Chats Seen by Journalist

description: President Donald Trump’s nominee to lead the Social Security Administration on Tuesday billed himself as an “efficiency guy” and said he’s given no thought to privatizing the agency, which has become a prime target of Elon Musk’s dramatic cost-cutting crusade.
title: Trump Pick Pledges to Protect Social Security During DOGE Cuts

description: US President Donald Trump’s administration has nominated Leo Brent Bozell III, a conservative activist and writer, to be the country’s ambassador to South Africa.
title: US Nominates Leo Brent Bozell III as Ambassador to S. Africa

description: President Donald Trump says the judge is a “Radical Left Lunatic” who should be impeached. The attorney general says he’s protecting terrorists. Justice Department lawyers say his rulings are undermining a vital effort to deport Venezuelan gang members.
title: Trump’s Judicial Foe Was Kavanaugh’s Roommate, Had GOP’s Backing

description: A group of Democratic-led states is again accusing President Donald Trump’s administration of violating a court order by failing to release millions of dollars in federal disaster funds, the latest fallout from a lawsuit over the White House’s chaotic January spending freeze.
title: Trump Still Not Unfreezing All Federal Funds, States Tell Judge

description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said his top cabinet ministers are in contact with White House officials and want to have “serious” negotiations about trade, as US trading partners brace for President Donald Trump’s next barrage of tariffs.
title: Carney Says Canada Wants to ‘Get Serious’ With Trump on Trade Talks

description: Paul Atkins, President Donald Trump’s nominee to lead the Securities and Exchange Commission, and his spouse have a combined net worth of at least $327 million, according to new disclosures.
title: SEC Chair Nominee Paul Atkins, Spouse Worth at Least $327 Million

description: Efforts by DOGE to claw back $1 billion in loans and grants for energy-efficiency upgrades have put plans for hundreds of housing developments at risk.
title: Affordable Housing Developers Stalled by Blocked Federal Funds

description: Russia and Ukraine may see a greater incentive to prolong the three-year conflict instead of rushing into a full settlement, according to an assessment by the US intelligence community that clashes with President Donald Trump’s pledges for a rapid end to the three-year conflict.
title: US Sees Russia, Ukraine Choosing a Longer War Over a Bad Deal

description: Syria emerges as a new destination for Moscow’s crude
title: Russian Crude Flows Hit Five-Month High While Peace Talks Drag

description: Bangladesh’s interim leader Muhammad Yunus will begin a four-day official visit to China on Wednesday, which will include talks with President Xi Jinping and top business executives.
title: Bangladesh’s Leader Yunus Seeks Deeper Ties With China in Visit

description: The European Union took steps to limit the amount of steel that can be imported into the bloc tariff-free as part of a broader effort to protect the sector from rising imports.
title: EU Tightens Steel Import Rules in Bid to Protect Sector

description: President Donald Trump expressed confidence in White House National Security Advisor Michael Waltz after the aide inadvertently included the editor in chief of the Atlantic in a text message group about planning for military strikes in Yemen.
title: Trump Backs Waltz After Breach on Houthi Strike Plans

description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre upgraded one of his key election promises to scrap the federal sales tax on new homes in Canada, expanding it to cover new residences worth less than C$1.3 million ($910,000).
title: Poilievre Boosts Pledge to Scrap Canada’s Sales Tax on Some Homes

description: Europe, Asia and America’s rivals all have something to learn.
title: US Allies Get a Signal Chat’s Worth of Red Flags

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said his government would give raises to the armed forces, speed up the acquisition of military equipment and grant new surveillance powers to the Canadian Coast Guard if he wins the election.
title: Carney Proposes Raises for Canada Military to Bolster Recruitment

description: South Sudan’s embattled vice president said the deployment of Ugandan troops in his country violates a United Nations arms embargo and risks collapsing a peace accord, as the UN warned the oil-producing nation is on the brink of civil war.
title: South Sudan Opposition Slams Uganda Deployment; UN Warns of War

description: The US Justice Department is fast-tracking fights over President Donald Trump’s efforts to push the bounds of executive power, teeing up key issues for the US Supreme Court in the coming weeks or even days.
title: Supreme Court Is Buckling Up for a Season of Legal Showdowns Over Trump Policies

description: A planned visit by US officials to Greenland this week is putting “unacceptable pressure” on the island and on Denmark, Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen said.
title: Danish Leader Raps US for ‘Unacceptable Pressure’ on Greenland

description: Canadians need a drink.
title: Canadians Sign Up for 1,461-Pack of Beer to Get Through Trump’s Term

description: The Kremlin said it won’t disclose details of 12 hours of negotiations between Russian and US officials in Saudi Arabia, sowing confusion about progress toward securing at least a partial ceasefire in the war in Ukraine.
title: Kremlin Says It Won’t Give Details of Talks With US Over Ukraine

description: The US said Russia and Ukraine have agreed to a ceasefire in the Black Sea and to work out mechanisms for implementing their ban on strikes against energy infrastructure.
title: US Says Russia and Ukraine Agree to Ceasefire in the Black Sea

description: The United Nations nuclear watchdog said its latest talks with a senior Iranian official failed to yield a breakthrough in its years-long atomic probe, underscoring the urgent need for a diplomatic solution to a tense standoff between the Islamic Republic and the US.
title: Nuclear Watchdog Hints at Iran Talks Soon as Trump Sets Deadline

description: Namibia’s freshly sworn-in president conveyed at her first cabinet meeting her zero tolerance for bureaucratic delay in the push to speed up policy reform.
title: Namibia’s New Leader Vows to Accelerate Reforms, Tackle Graft

description: The Trump administration refused to hand over flight data requested by a federal judge about the deportation of alleged Venezuelan gang members to El Salvador, warning that doing so would put state secrets at risk.
title: Trump Refuses to Disclose Data on Deportation Flights to Judge

description: Israel’s parliament is set to approve the state budget for this year, delivering a political respite for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu after days of turmoil sent assets tumbling.
title: Israel Set to Pass Budget in Political Respite for Netanyahu

description: China should raise consumption to a level close to those of developed countries in the next decade, a government adviser said, adding to calls to rebalance the world’s second-largest economy away from investment and export.
title: China Adviser Urges Boosting Consumption to 70% of GDP by 2035

description: A UK minister criticized Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves for accepting free tickets to a music concert, highlighting her struggle for popularity in the governing Labour Party just a day before she is due to deliver her spring fiscal statement outlining cuts that are expected to total billions of pounds.
title: UK Minister Says Reeves’ Free Concert Tickets ‘Not Appropriate’

description: Detentions and deportations have cast an unflattering spotlight on the way the US treats visitors.
title: Has the US Become a Hostile Environment for Tourists?

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Contempt for Europe in Trump’s Inner Circle

description: Dartmouth College’s president said proposals to hike endowment taxes threaten the school’s research capabilities and its ability to enroll the best students.
title: Dartmouth President Says Endowment Tax Hike Threatens Research

description: Swazi Tshabalala, South Africa’s candidate to head the African Development Bank, knows exactly what she’ll do if she gets the job.
title: Banker Vying to Run Top African Lender Has Eye on Infrastructure

description: Mozambique’s most prominent opposition leader, who’s orchestrated months of demonstrations that have battered the country’s economy, said he agreed with the president to end post-election violence that’s left hundreds of people dead.
title: Mozambique Opposition Head Says He And President Agree to Peace

description: Australia’s center-left government unveiled an unexpected tax cut and an extension of energy rebates in a pre-election budget designed to soothe voters’ cost-of-living concerns and help secure Prime Minister Anthony Albanese a second term in office.
title: Australia Unveils Surprise Tax Cuts in Pre-Election Budget

description: As Australians prepare to head to the polls, the government unveiled its 2025-26 federal budget, which promises further relief for all taxpayers, as well as some incentives for families with kids in early childhood education, student debt holders and beer drinkers. Here’s a breakdown of some of the winners and losers in Treasurer Jim Chalmers’ pre-election fiscal blueprint.
title: Australia 2025 Federal Budget: Who Were the Winners and Losers

description: Ukrainian and US teams are locked in another round of talks in Riyadh to discuss a 30-day energy and the Black Sea ceasefire in Russia’s war, a person with the knowledge of the matter said.
title: Ukraine, US Teams Said to Be Holding More Talks in Saudi Arabia

description: The UK government is ending a contract worth £2 billion ($2.6 billion) a year with a company that provides around a quarter of the country’s accommodation for asylum seekers, citing unspecified concerns about its performance and behavior.
title: Labour Scraps £2 Billion-a-Year Migrant Hotels Contract

description: A UK watchdog fined PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP and one of its accountants over their flawed audit of Sanjeev Gupta’s Wyelands Bank following the collapse of the trade finance specialist Greensill Capital.
title: PwC Fined Over Audit of Gupta’s Wyelands Bank by UK Watchdog

description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is planning “powerful” measures to ease the impact on consumers coming from price hikes, according to local media reports.
title: Ishiba Plans ‘Powerful’ Inflation Measures Ahead of Election

description: A Tokyo court ordered the dissolution of a religious group whose fundraising methods and ties with ruling party politicians came under scrutiny following the assassination of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe more than two years ago.
title: Tokyo Court Orders Dissolution of Church Linked to Abe Murder

description: Asia’s economy will avoid a slowdown this year even as US President Donald Trump escalates his campaign to put pressure on countries by raising tariffs, according to a report issued at China’s premier international conference.
title: China’s Davos Offers Upbeat Read on Asian Economy Facing Tariffs

description: The longtime epicenter of global public health, peacemaking and diplomacy is being squeezed by budget cuts that could redefine its identity
title: Trump Slashed International Aid. Geneva Is Feeling the Impact.

description: Turkey’s finance minister is set to hold a call with foreign investors on Tuesday, the latest attempt by the government to calm markets after the tumult triggered by a key opposition figure’s arrest.
title: Turkey Finance Czar Will Meet Investors to Ease Pressure on Lira

description: Ever since AstraZeneca Plc shocked investors in October with news its China chief was under investigation, the British pharmaceutical giant has tried to maintain a business-as-usual stance in its second-biggest market.
title: AstraZeneca Seeks to Move Past China Probe With Beijing R&D Hub

description: President Donald Trump appeared to invent a new weapon of economic statecraft on Monday by threatening what he dubbed “secondary tariffs” on countries that buy oil from Venezuela to choke off its oil trade with other nations.
title: Trump’s Threat of ‘Secondary Tariffs’ Invents New Trade Weapon

description: The exposure of private texts between top US officials offered unique insight into their planning for strikes against Houthi militants earlier this month. The messages also laid bare the full extent of their disdain for European allies.
title: Trump Cabinet Messaging Breach Confirms Fears of European Allies

description: China has freed five Mintz Group employees who were detained in 2023, the Financial Times reported.
title: China Frees Mintz Employees After Two-Year Detention, FT Says

description: The two largest US teachers’ unions and a prominent civil-rights group sued the Trump administration for moving to abolish the Education Department, adding to a growing number of lawsuits against the president’s far-reaching efforts to transform the federal government.
title: Education Department Defenders Sue to Block Trump’s Overhaul

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said she’ll put £2 billion ($2.6 billion) of grant funding into social and affordable homes as the UK’s Labour government works toward a target of building 1.5 million new residences over five years.
title: UK Plows £2 Billion Into Grants to Build 18,000 New Social Homes

description: Radico Khaitan Ltd. has been producing alcohol for Indian drinkers at its Rampur distillery since 1943 — four years before the nation gained its independence.
title: Trump Pushes ‘Tariff King’ India to Tear Down Trade Barriers
